title: How To Eat Healthy When Eating Out
summary: When possible, choose dishes that are packed with fiber and protein. Whole grains are a great source of fiber, B vitamins, iron, and other nutrients. Check the ingredients list for the items that go into your meal. Be wary of French fries, fried veggies and other fried sides. Be careful of burgers that come with 80% meat or less, and be careful with your bun and condiment choices. Avoid heavy white breads and load up on veggies and lean proteins instead of heavy breads.

You can also add beans to salads for even more protein."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Stuffed veggies - Choose dishes that are stuffed with veggies, like bell peppers and mushrooms, over ones that come with heavy sauces or too much cheese."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Pasta - Choose whole-wheat pasta to up the fiber content.")),mdx("h2",null,"Look for whole grains"),mdx("p",null,"Whole grains are a great source of fiber, B vitamins, iron, and other nutrients. Some examples:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Pesto - Pesto is typically made with olive oil, so it\u2019s an unprocessed fat with minimal calories and fat."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Salsa - Choose salsa over creamy sauces like alfredo or ranch."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Marinara - Marinara sauce is typically made with tomatoes and onions, so it\u2019s a very healthy option.")),mdx("h2",null,"Check the ingredients list"),mdx("p",null,"When you can, check the ingredients list for the items that go into your meal. This will help you spot potential allergens and unhealthy ingredients that you might otherwise miss. You can also use this information to make healthier choices. For example:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If a meal comes with rice, beans, and veggies, you can ask if they can replace the rice with additional veggies."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If a meal comes with white pasta, you can ask if they can use whole-wheat pasta instead."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If a meal comes with heavy sauces or cheese, ask if they can leave it out or substitute it for something healthier.")),mdx("h2",null,"Order veggies"),mdx("p",null,"Many restaurants will let you add as many veggies as you want to your meal. You can ask to add veggies to anything\u2014salads, soups, pastas, stir-frys, sandwiches, and more. And if a restaurant is too fancy for this, you can always DIY by ordering a side of veggies to go with your meal."),mdx("p",null,"In general, though, be careful with your vegetable choices. Some vegetables are higher in calories and fat than others. And many restaurants will fry or fry-fry their veggies in unhealthy oils. Be wary of French fries, fried veggies, and other fried sides."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t be afraid of the dark side"),mdx("p",null,"Burgers, sandwiches, and other classic casual fare can be healthy options when eaten in moderation. Look for burgers that are made with 80% meat or less, and be careful with your bun and condiment choices. When possible, choose burgers that come with lettuce and tomato over buns, and skip the mayo or heavy sauces for a healthier option."),mdx("p",null,"Sandwiches can also be a healthy choice, as long as you choose wisely. Avoid heavy white breads and load up on veggies and lean proteins instead. Wraps can be great options if you\u2019re unsure about the contents of your sandwich."),mdx("h2",null,"Final words"),mdx("p",null,"Eating out can be enjoyable and healthy, but it can also be challenging. The best way to overcome these challenges is to be prepared and knowledgeable. By following these tips, you will be able to make better decisions when eating out and keep your diet in check. relatedArticles.title: How to Stick to Your Healthy Eating Goals

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The New Year brings new resolutions and the challenge to stick to them. But how can you make sure you succeed this time? Planning and preparation are key to any endeavor, including sticking to your healthy eating goals in the New Year. Thinking ahead and making a plan will help you avoid pitfalls and stay on track. After all, it\u2019s not about failing once but rather keeping failure at bay so it doesn\u2019t creep up again next year.
Many people struggle with their eating habits because they lack structure or fail to plan ahead. That\u2019s why creating a strategy is essential if you want to maintain this commitment for good. Whether it\u2019s going on a diet, cutting out certain foods or reducing your intake of fats, proteins or carbs \u2013 there are different ways how you can achieve your goals. Here are some helpful tips:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 8 Ways to Make Healthy Eating More Exciting

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s world, it\u2019s not easy to stick to healthy eating habits. Everywhere you look there are temptations that make it difficult to eat the right things. However, with the right approach and mindset, healthy eating doesn\u2019t have to be boring or restrictive. You just need a bit of inspiration and ideas on how to make healthy eating exciting again. Eating well doesn\u2019t need to be dull or uninteresting \u2013 in fact, it can be quite the opposite if you bring your A-game to the table.
If you\u2019re struggling with making healthy eating more exciting, here are some ways that can help get you back on track so you can enjoy great food while still feeling good about what you\u2019re putting in your body.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with Cravings and Temptations
5 Ways to Get Fit without a Gym Membership

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s fast-paced society, most of us struggle to find time to exercise. While it\u2019s easy to overlook the benefits of exercising when you have a packed day, staying active can have a positive impact on your life. The American Council on Exercise states that being active has been proven as beneficial for mental and physical health as well as quality of life. The following are 5 ways to get fit without a gym membership.
With the rise in popularity of home gyms and personal training, more people than ever before are getting fit without stepping foot into a gym. In this article, we explore five ways you can get fit without joining a gym or purchasing an expensive home setup. Whether you have a small apartment or live in an area with limited outdoor activities, there are many different ways you can stay active and get fit without spending money on a gym membership or personal trainer.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Tips for Keeping Your Hair Healthy and Strong

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Keeping your hair healthy can be a challenge at times, but it's important to keep on top of things in order to prevent any further damage. Whether you have fine and sensitive locks or thick and curly tresses, the right routine will help keep your hair strong and prevent it from breaking under pressure. Keeping your hair strong is an ongoing process, but by adopting some simple tips you can make things much easier on your locks long term.
Learn how to avoid over-washing, what products are best for stronger hair, as well as what you should be doing if you see strands falling out more than normal. The latter might seem strange, but trust us: sooner rather than later that excess hair loss could indicate something more serious happening beneath the surface. Here are 10 ways to keep your hair healthy and strong...`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get in Shape for Summer - Tips for Every Fitness Level

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When summer rolls around, everyone seems to want to look their best. After all, it\u2019s the season of tank tops, swimsuits, and short shorts. The problem is that not everyone hits the gym year-round or has access to a gym that fits their needs. If you tend to slack on your fitness game once the snow begins falling and leaves start falling from the trees again, now is the time to start making changes so that you\u2019re ready for summer.
Whether you\u2019re looking for ways to get back in shape after a long winter hibernation or just hoping to avoid ending up in an unflattering bathing suit this summer, hitting the gym as often as possible is essential. But what if you don\u2019t have a gym membership? Or what if you can only commit to working out at home? Luckily we have some great tips for how you can get in shape for summer no matter where you are.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Way to Start Your Day - With a Healthy Morning Routine

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In a world that moves as fast as ours, it can be easy to get caught up in the daily hustle and forget about the little things. But those little things are what make all the difference in the end. Take morning routines, for example. They may not seem like much on their own, but they have the power to make or break your day from start to finish.
With so many different morning routines out there, it can be difficult to know which one is right for you. There are those that are super long and involved, and others that are much shorter and simpler. Whether you\u2019re looking for something simple or something a little more intense, we\u2019ve got you covered with this ultimate guide on how to start your day with a healthy routine.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: A Beginner's Guide to Meditation and Its Benefits

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The idea of sitting still and focusing on your breathing might sound a bit too challenging at first, but meditation is actually much simpler than you might think. If you\u2019ve been struggling to find balance in your life and keep your stress levels under control, meditation is just what you need. As we go through this hectic world, our minds are constantly racing from one thought to another without even noticing. Most of us have a hard time dealing with the pressures of everyday life, which is why meditation can be such a great tool for clearing our mind and finding peace once again. It also helps reduce stress, lift our mood, increase self-awareness and make us more compassionate human beings. So if you\u2019re ready to adopt the practice of meditation in your life on a regular basis, read on \u2013 we\u2019ve got all the details you need!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Stay Healthy during Cold and Flu Season

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Getting the flu or a cold is inevitable. In fact, you could get sick around this time every year without fail. The only thing you can do is take precautions and try to avoid catching a bug in the first place. However, even with good intentions and best efforts, the odds are stacked against you. These viruses are so common that virtually everyone has been exposed to them at some point in their lives, generally during childhood.
Thankfully there are ways to reduce your risk of contracting these viruses and being able to recover quickly if they manage to sneak through your defenses. Cold and flu season brings with it stressors like school, work, family obligations and end-of-year deadlines\u2014not exactly ideal conditions for keeping your immune system strong!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Healthy Diet - And How to Stick to It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`A healthy diet is a significant part of any healthy lifestyle. It\u2019s also one of the most difficult to maintain. With all the tempting fast food, vending machine snacks, and restaurants with cheap but high-calorie meals, it\u2019s not easy to eat right. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to make sticking to a healthy diet easier.
If you want to improve your health, increase your energy, and lose weight\u2014while still enjoying great food\u2014a healthy diet is the way to do it. A healthy diet can help prevent disease and keep you feeling great. Following these tips can get you well on your way towards meeting your nutrition goals and eating a balanced diet that will keep you happy and healthy for life.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
